repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Enterprise Export
            Facility Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is highly likely;
            institutional development impact is high; Bank performance
            is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is satisfactory.
            The initial concept for the project addressed issues that
            were identified by exporting enterprises at the time of
            appraisal, namely: (1) "pre shipment" or pre
            delivery working capital for identified export contracts,
            and (2) support to an identified group of exporters required
            to provide guarantees from highly rated commercial banks to
            secure export contracts. The more traditional activities of
            an export credit agency such as guarantees without finance
            and credit insurance were not addressed because at the time
            of appraisal they were not requested by the banking or
            exporting community. As activity increased at the Investment
            Guarantee Agency (IGA), it was realized that the more
            traditional activities of an export credit agency needed to
            be included in order to provide a comprehensive service to
            the exporting and banking community. The project was
            restructured to provide IGA with the authority to use World
            Bank funds under the project to support these additional
            facilities. At the same time, it was realized that if IGA
            was to be effective as an export credit agency, have
            permanent status, and have the same impact on exports as its
            counterparts in nearby countries such as the Czech Republic,
            Hungary, Poland, Slovakia and Slovenia it would need to have
            equity capital that was adequate in accordance with accepted
            prudential standards within the industry. Accordingly, the
            initiative was commenced by IGA and the government to create
            new law for IGA by government legislation and to transfer
            the donor and project funds under the Emergency Industrial
            Restart Project and this project, onto the balance sheet of
            IGA. The impact of the project during the implementation
            period would have been greater had IGA been authorized to
            use World Bank funds to support these traditional facilities
            from the time of effectiveness, and project funds had been
            transferred to IGA as equity progressively as funds were
            drawn down from the Bank.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Export Enterprise
            Facility Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Enterprise Export Facility Project
            for Bosnia and Herzegovina aims to support sustainable
            economic growth by facilitating and expanding viable export
            activity. There are three project components. The first
            component consists of a working capital facility, a
            revolving line of credit that provides working capital loans
            to exporting enterprises having specific and signed export
            contracts. The second component comprises a performance bond
            facility which allows companies to tender for major
            construction and supply export contracts by giving security
            to bond giving banks. This security is provided by placing
            International Development Association (IDA) funds on trust
            in an offshore bank account available to reimburse
            commercial insurance companies that will guarantee the bond
            givers. The third component provides technical assistance to
            strengthen the Investment Guarantee Agency (IGA) and
            exporters. It institutionally reinforces the IGA's
            operations by building its credit assessment capability,
            assisting it in processing applications for working
            capital/performance bonds; and finances short-term
            assistance in such areas as financial management, auditing,
            and legal and environmental services. This component makes
            the services of external consultants available to exporters,
            and finances office equipment and vehicles for IGA as well
            as its operating costs.
